newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Zimbabwe's TA to cut 1,300 jobs - report.
newsitem.headline: Zimbabwe's TA to cut 1,300 jobs - report.

text.p: Zimbabwean conglomerate TA Holdings plans a major streamlining programme, including the axing of 1,300 jobs, the weekly Business Herald said on Thursday.

It quoted TA Holdings chief executive Timothy Chiganze as saying that under the plan, operating profit was set to rise to Z$543 million by the turn of the century from the present annual average of Z$117 million.
Chiganze said the corporation would continue to sell off loss-making, non-core businesses and would also cut its 6,776-strong workforce by 20 percent.
"We have been trying to stop the bleeding through the sale of loss-making operations. Our aim is to take opportunities as they arise and drop bad risk as quickly as possible," he said.
The corporation has for the past two years been shedding its non-core operations and had disposed of 32 firms as of May 31 this year.
It has identified its core businesses in insurance and financial services, foods, hotels and refrigeration.

Chiganze said the corporation intended to open 12 wholesale outlets by the year 2000 and embark on several other projects. He said funds for the investments would come from proceeds from the sale of its non-core assets, a planned rights issue and the group's profits.
